de.unisiegen.tpml.core.languages.l4
Class L4Scanner

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.languages.AbstractLanguageScanner
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.languages.l4.L4Scanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
L4Terminals, LanguageScanner, java_cup.runtime.Scanner
 class L4Scanner
extends AbstractLanguageScanner
implements L4Terminals

This is the lexer class for L4.

Method Detail

getStyleBySymbolId

public PrettyStyle getStyleBySymbolId(int id)
Description copied from class: AbstractLanguageScanner
Returns the PrettyStyle for the specified symbol id, for example PrettyStyle.KEYWORD if the id refers to the token "let". This method must be implemented by all lexers generated by JFlex.

Specified by:
getStyleBySymbolId in class AbstractLanguageScanner
Parameters:
id - the unique identifier of a symbol.
Returns:
the PrettyStyle for the symbol id.
See Also:
AbstractLanguageScanner.getStyleBySymbol(LanguageSymbol)

restart

public void restart(Reader reader)
Description copied from interface: LanguageScanner
Restarts the scanner with the specified reader, and resets the complete internal state to the initial state, starting at parsing the input stream of the specified reader.

Specified by:
restart in interface LanguageScanner
Parameters:
reader - the new Reader.

yyclose

public final void yyclose()
                   throws IOException
Closes the input stream.

Throws:
IOException

yyreset

public final void yyreset(Reader reader)
Resets the scanner to read from a new input stream. Does not close the old reader. All internal variables are reset, the old input stream cannot be reused (internal buffer is discarded and lost). Lexical state is set to ZZ_INITIAL.

Parameters:
reader - the new input stream

yystate

public final int yystate()
Returns the current lexical state.

yybegin

public final void yybegin(int newState)
Enters a new lexical state

Parameters:
newState - the new lexical state

yytext

public final String yytext()
Returns the text matched by the current regular expression.

yycharat

public final char yycharat(int pos)
Returns the character at position pos from the matched text. It is equivalent to yytext().charAt(pos), but faster

Parameters:
pos - the position of the character to fetch. A value from 0 to yylength()-1.
Returns:
the character at position pos

yylength

public final int yylength()
Returns the length of the matched text region.

yypushback

public void yypushback(int number)
Pushes the specified amount of characters back into the input stream. They will be read again by then next call of the scanning method

Parameters:
number - the number of characters to be read again. This number must not be greater than yylength()!

nextSymbol

public LanguageSymbol nextSymbol()
                          throws IOException,
                                 LanguageScannerException
Resumes scanning until the next regular expression is matched, the end of input is encountered or an I/O-Error occurs.

Specified by:
nextSymbol in interface LanguageScanner
Returns:
the next token
Throws:
IOException - if any I/O-Error occurs
LanguageScannerException - if a syntax error occurred while trying to scan the input stream.
